metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5815 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Type confusion in xsltNumberFormatGetMultipleLevel prior to libxslt 1.1.33 could allow attackers to potentially exploit heap corruption via crafted XML data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5815` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 75.0.3770.80-0ubuntu1~snap2
chromium-browser-l10n - 75.0.3770.80-0ubuntu1~snap2
chromium-chromedriver - 75.0.3770.80-0ubuntu1~snap2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 75.0.3770.80-0ubuntu1~snap2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 75.0.3770.80-0ubuntu1~snap2
No subscription required

libxslt1.1 - 1.1.34-4build2
xsltproc - 1.1.34-4build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '75.0.3770.80-0ubuntu1~snap2').
libxslt package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.34-4build2').
